unit.name: Group 18: Nobel Gases
unit.content: The Nobel Gases (also "Inert Gases") form the 18. group in the peridic table of the elements. They have the elektronconfiguration s2p6 which means they have a full valenzshell. Because of this their chemical reactivity if very low. Their very high ionizationenergies demenstrate this. Most elements form ions with this electro-configuration (nobel-gas configuration). Because nobel gases have no unpaired electrons their elemental state is atomic (unlike eg. oxigen). They don't small, have no colours, are non toxic and not inflamable. The atoms don't share van-der-waals forces. Thus, their melting- and boilingpoints are very low. Both increase with the number of protons because this causes a bigger atom radius which make the atoms polarisable [[I made that word up ;-) It means: for a very short time the atoms have a charge]]. This polarization increases the van-der-waals forces. Helium has the lowest boilingpoint of all known matter. The nobel gases have a share of 0.035% in the air. Ne: 1.6E-3, He: 5E-4, Kr:1E-4, Xe: 9E-6
